title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 10 november [1868]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 10 November [1868]
text: Tuesday 1868November 10My dear Walteri have received your letter to day although it was short it was better than none i am always glad to hear from you if its only a line i have to announce the death of little Charley manMann he died last thursdayThursday morning with the dipthereadiphtheria croup suffered very much so pressed for breath poor little boy it made me feel real sad he and Janey was up in my room on saturdaySaturday and he set in a chair quiet so unusual for him he didentdidn't seem to be very well and sundaySunday he was not so well and lived till thursdayThursday poor little fellow i miss him very much they had the funeral last sundaySunday he was put in a casket lined with white satin cost 100 dollerdollars)well Walter i have had a letter from Jeff and one from Matty the letter you sent of mine stirred them up matt said i wrote to you i didentdidn't know what i would do if it wasentwasn't for your letters the rest didentdidn't put themselves out to write to me she said she knew i meant them so now she will write every sundaySunday i wrote to her yesterday) and to han to day and sent her one dollar and 25 cts) i have had a letter from her a good letter she says she shall come home she cantcan't doodo so well in fixing her things in consequence of losing her thumb i sent her a dollar the other time and i wrote for her to get her things made and i would send her some change every time to pay it she wonders why walterWalter dontdon't write to her as he used to when you write walterWalter dear put a couple of dollars in the letter itsit's better to not put much in a letter in these days there is so many broken open and robbedgood biehas mrMr. OconorO'Connor got home yet)georgeGeorge is away to camdenCamden Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 10 November [1868]
